column2: Deus meus
column3: respice in mē; quārē mē dērelīquistī? Longē ā salūte meā verba dēlictōrum meōrum. ^ O God my God
column4: look upon me; why hast thou forsaken me? Far from my salvation are the words of my sins.

column2: et nōn exaudiēs
column3: et nocte
column4: et nōn ad insapientiam mihi. ^ O my God
column8: and it shall not be reputed as folly in me.

column2: laus Isrāēlis. ^ But thou dwellest in the holy place
column3: the praise of Israel.

column1: 5 ^ In tē spērāvērunt patrēs nostrī; spērāvērunt
column2: et līberāvistī eōs. ^ In thee have our fathers hoped; they have hoped
column3: and thou hast delivered them.

column2: et salvī factī sunt; in tē spērāvērunt
column3: et nōn sunt confūsī. ^ They cried to thee
column4: and they were saved; they trusted in thee

column2: et nōn homō; opprobrium hominum
column3: et abjectiō plēbis. ^ But I am a worm
column4: and no man; the reproach of men
column5: and the outcast of the people.

column2: dērīsērunt mē; locūtī sunt labiīs
column3: et mōvērunt caput. ^ All they that saw me have laughed me to scorn; they have spoken with the lips

column2: ēripiat eum; salvum faciat eum
column3: quoniam vult eum. ^ He hoped in the Lord
column4: let him deliver him; let him save him

column2: quī extrāxistī mē dē ventre; spēs mea ab ūberibus mātris meae. ^ For thou art he that hast drawn me out of the womb; my hope from the breasts of my mother.

column1: 11 ^ In tē prōjectus sum ex uterō; dē ventre mātris meae Deus meus es tū; ^ I was cast upon thee from the womb; from my mother's womb thou art my God;

column2: quoniam trībulātiō proxima est
column3: quoniam nōn est quī adjuvet. ^ depart not from me
column5: for there is none to help me.

column1: 13 ^ Circumdedērunt mē vitulī multī; taurī pinguēs obsēdērunt mē. ^ Many calves have surrounded me; fat bulls have besieged me.

column2: sīcut leō rapiens et rugiens. ^ They have opened their mouths against me
column3: as a lion ravening and roaring.

column2: et dispersa sunt omnia ossa mea. Factum est cor meum tamquam cēra liquēscens in mediō ventris meī. ^ I am poured out like water
column3: and all my bones are scattered. My heart is become like wax melting in the midst of my bowels.

column2: et lingua mea adhaesit faucibus meīs
column3: et in pulverem mortis dēdūxistī mē. ^ My strength is dried up like a potsherd
column4: and my tongue hath cleaved to my jaws
column5: and thou hast brought me down into the dust of death.

column1: 17 ^ Quoniam circumdedērunt mē canēs multī; concilium malignantium obsēdit mē. Fōdērunt manūs meās et pedēs meōs; ^ For many dogs have encompassed me; the council of the malignant hath besieged me. They have dug my hands and feet;
18 ^ dīnumerāvērunt omnia ossa mea. Ipsī vērō consīderāvērunt et inspexērunt mē. ^ they have numbered all my bones. But they have looked and stared upon me.

column2: et super vestem meam mīsērunt sortem. ^ They parted my garments amongst them
column3: and upon my vesture they cast lots.

column1: 20 ^ Tū autem Domine nē ēlongāverīs auxilium tuum ā mē; ad dēfensiōnem meam conspice. ^ But thou
column2: O Lord
column3: remove not thy help to a distance from me; look towards my defence.

column2: Deus
column3: animam meam
column4: et dē manū canis ūnicam meam. ^ Deliver
column7: and my only one from the hand of the dog.

column2: et ā cornibus ūnicornium humilitātem meam. ^ Save me from the lion's mouth
column3: and my lowness from the horns of the unicorns.

column1: 23 ^ Narrābō nōmen tuum frātribus meīs; in mediō ecclēsiae laudābō tē. ^ I will declare thy name to my brethren; in the midst of the church will I praise thee.
24 ^ Quī timētis Dominum laudāte eum; ūniversum sēmen Jācōbis glōrificāte eum; timeat eum omne sēmen Isrāēlis
column2: ^ Ye that fear the Lord
column3: praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob
column4: glorify him; let all the seed of Israel fear him

column2: neque dēspexit dēprecātiōnem pauperis
column3: nec āvertit faciem suam ā mē
column4: et quum clāmārem ad eum exaudīvit mē. ^ because he hath not slighted nor despised the supplication of the poor man
column5: neither hath he turned away his face from me
column6: and when I cried to him he heard me.

column1: 26 ^ Apud tē laus mea in ecclēsiā magnā; vōta mea reddam in conspectū timentium eum. ^ With thee is my praise in a great church; I will pay my vows in the sight of them that fear him.

column2: et saturābuntur
column3: et laudābunt Dominum quī requīrunt eum; vīvent corda eōrum in saeculum saeculī. ^ The poor shall eat
column5: and they shall praise the Lord that seek him; their hearts shall live for ever and ever.

column1: 28 ^ Reminīscentur et convertentur ad Dominum ūniversī fīnēs terrae
column2: et adōrābunt in conspectū ejus ūniversae familiae Gentium. ^ All the ends of the earth shall remember
column3: and shall be converted to the Lord
column4: and all the kindreds of the Gentiles shall adore in his sight.

column2: et ipse dominābitur Gentium. ^ For the kingdom is the Lord's
column3: and he shall have dominion over the nations.

column1: 30 ^ Mandūcāvērunt et adōrāvērunt omnēs pinguēs terrae; in conspectū ejus cadent omnēs quī dēscendunt in terram. ^ All the fat ones of the earth have eaten and have adored; all they that go down to the earth shall fall before him.

column2: et sēmen meum serviet ipsī. ^ And to him my soul shall live
column3: and my seed shall serve him.

column2: et adnūntiābunt caelī jūstitiam ejus populō quī nāscētur
column3: quem fēcit Dominus. ^ There shall be declared to the Lord a generation to come
column4: and the heavens shall show forth his justice to a people that shall be born
